items.content_html:
1. added a link back to MDN Intro to Express
  2. text revisions in the intro for clarity
  3. removed "X.XX" placeholder text under the Objective section

On this page, I also notice a lack of consistency in referring to Node and in the use of emphasis. To make it easier to review this PR, but I will leave these issues for another PR.

MDN URL
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Server-side/Express_Nodejs/development_environment
items.title: add link to Node Dev Environment doc

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

Remove currentTime and duration from attributes since they are not content attributes.

MDN URL of the main page changed

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/audio

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

#5019

Anything else that could help us review it

Also changed disableRemotePlayback to disableremoteplayback since all content attributes are lowercase.
items.title: Remove currentTime and duration from attributes

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

I don't think the tabindex needs to be listed here at all.

None.

Anything else that could help us review it

None.
items.title: Remove tabindex from <area> attribute list

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

I think the description of the flex-basis: auto behavior came out a little vague.
The author talked about the max-content sizing fallback during the whole article, so it seemed to me that quoting it in this section made sense.
I'm suggesting a subjective and minor improvement, please feel free to decline if you don't agree with me (:

MDN URL of the main page changed

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Flexible_Box_Layout/Controlling_Ratios_of_Flex_Items_Along_the_Main_Ax
items.title: improve flex-basis: auto explanation
Release notes for NSS 3.65

Some of the font-family containing whitespaces were not quoted

Quoted font-family having whitespaces.

#4970
items.title: fix(#4970) : font-family

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

browser.extension.getURL() is deprecated, browser.runtim.getURL() should be used instead.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Your_second_WebExtension
items.title: Your second extension: replace deprecated calls to getUrl()

items.content_html:
Fixes #4848

Adds a line about the fact pseudo-elements can't be used in the selector list.
items.title: add info about pseudo-elements

items.content_html:
Adds SVGMarkerElement.

Spec: https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG2/painting.html#InterfaceSVGMarkerElement

Reviewer: @jpmedley

This was a fairly fiddly one, the SVG API docs are pretty inconsistent. There is no overview page I can find for Interfaces, and lots of missing bits.
items.title: Adds the SVGMarkerElement Interface

items.content_html: This attempts to document the Markdown syntax for <dl> that we have discussed in #4367.
items.title: Add dl syntax to Markdown spec

items.content_html:
The term "General header" is no longer used in the HTTP/1.1 spec. This change replaces that glossary term in the HTTP header doc information tables that are affected by a comma separate list of the Request, Response headers.

Discussion on this in #4889 (comment)

There is more work to be done around this, but will do as separate PR.
items.title: Modify HTTP General headers to refer to Request/Response headers

items.content_html:
This PR makes some fairly major updates to the https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope/setTimeout page.

This started out as a fix for #4971, but when I looked at the page I thought https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope/setTimeout#reasons_for_delays needed updates.

I've made quite a few changes in the end, in particular:

  • make the page into the normal structure for API reference pages
  • remove old Firefox info, and generally tried to make it less about Firefox implementation details
    • removed the polyfill, and a section that suggests replacing the native setTimeout, which didn't seem like a good suggestion
  • rewritten the "throttling" example, which didn't really make sense to me.

It's a bit hard to know where to stop with something like this, so I;m quite open to feedback if I've gone too far!
items.title: Updates to setTimeout

items.content_html:
Fixes #4978

Bold markup is no longer rendered in pre tags but the example referred to a line highlighted in bold.
items.title: Django:Authent - fix see in bold description

items.content_html:
Once mdn/yari#3798 lands this PR will work.
It's nice to not have to mention the absolute URL for image references.

Note: This is almost a revert of #4972
but I didn't use a git revert because I like the rename of the image file name.
items.title: use short path for image used in live sample

items.content_html:
This won't work until mdn/yari#3798 has landed.

What I did was I found a page that uses https://mdn.mozillademos.org/files/* in the CSS <pre> tag. I then ran wget to download that image file into the same folder as the index.html.
The image flaw checker should be OK with starsolid.gif being present where it is even though it can't find a <img src="starsolid.gif"> in the HTML because the image reference flaw checker only looks for starsolid.gif anywhere inside the index.html as a string.
items.title: rid of mdn.mozillademos.org in CSS live samples (part 1)

items.content_html:
Fixes #4943.

I'm not sure this is the best fix, but since people keep filing this bug it would be better to have something here.
items.title: Simple fix for iframe example
Add Proxy link to See also subsction

items.content_html:
Bumps actions/setup-node from 2 to 2.1.5.

Release notes

Sourced from actions/setup-node's releases.

v2.1.5 Release

Improve error and warning line number handling (problem matcher regex)

v2.1.4

The first stable release of actions/setup-node V2

v2.1.3 (beta)

  • Add support for specifying architecture of Node.JS

v2.1.2 (beta)

  • Updated communication with runner to use environment files rather then workflow commands

v2.1.1 (beta)

Switch to main branch of node-versions repository to consume latest added versions.

v2.1.0 (beta)

Added check-latest input option to query the versions manifest for latest version before checking for semver match in local VM cache first (the default). That's useful for ensuring you get latest as soon as it's released to the cache but at the cost of perf / reliability (much more likely to incur and download and extract).

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: chore(deps): bump actions/setup-node from 2 to 2.1.5

items.content_html:
Bumps actions/checkout from 2 to 2.3.4.

Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v2.3.4

  • Add missing awaits
  • Swap to Environment Files

v2.3.3

  • Remove Unneeded commit information from build logs
  • Add Licensed to verify third party dependencies

v2.3.2

Add Third Party License Information to Dist Files

v2.3.1

Fix default branch resolution for .wiki and when using SSH

v2.3.0

Fallback to the default branch

v2.2.0

Fetch all history for all tags and branches when fetch-depth=0

v2.1.1

Changes to support GHES (here and here)

v2.1.0

  • Group output
  • Changes to support GHES alpha release
  • Persist core.sshCommand for submodules
  • Add support ssh
  • Convert submodule SSH URL to HTTPS, when not using SSH
  • Add submodule support
  • Follow proxy settings
  • Fix ref for pr closed event when a pr is merged
  • Fix issue checking detached when git less than 2.22
Changelog

Sourced from actions/checkout's changelog.

Changelog

v2.3.1

  • Fix default branch resolution for .wiki and when using SSH

v2.3.0

  • Fallback to the default branch

v2.2.0

  • Fetch all history for all tags and branches when fetch-depth=0

v2.1.1

  • Changes to support GHES (here and here)

v2.1.0

  • Group output
  • Changes to support GHES alpha release
  • Persist core.sshCommand for submodules
  • Add support ssh
  • Convert submodule SSH URL to HTTPS, when not using SSH
  • Add submodule support
  • Follow proxy settings
  • Fix ref for pr closed event when a pr is merged
  • Fix issue checking detached when git less than 2.22

v2.0.0

  • Do not pass cred on command line
  • Add input persist-credentials
  • Fallback to REST API to download repo
